text: my name is Jorge
Armando Martinez I'm 28 years old and I
came to the US on a surfboard from Cuba
my life in Cuba was very difficult
there's a lot of hardship there and I
had to find a better life for my
daughter
so I started to train as a windsurfer to
get ready to come to the US I had to
sell almost all my belongings I only
kept my bed my fan and the windsurfing
kit there was a group of us with the
same idea all we had to do was train
hard and get ready for the unknown we
didn't really know what to expect on the
Florida Straits I was only carrying a
bottle of water and around 10 sweets the
trip was supposed to take just five or
six hours
I knew I could reach speeds of up to 50
or 60 km/h with that board I didn't
expect to have so many problems after
four days of sea I began to get used to
it
I ration my water and had a sip every
day one night I started hallucinate I
thought I was in a forest I was quite
confident about my route thanks to a
compass I had on my wrist will kept me
on the right path I got too much kisses
keys which was on my right there was a
beach and that was where someone found
me some fishermen were passing by very
close to me they saw me and they asked
me if I was a rafter I said no I'm just
very thirsty please have you got some
water and they called the Coast Guard
they took me by boat to an ambulance
that was waiting for me in Key West and
then went straight to hospital I was in
very bad shape dehydrated but I think
everything will go well for me here
because I enjoy working I like the
challenge of being in a developed
country that gives you the opportunity
to work honestly and to live like a
person
